etymologies: Middle English enditement, inditement, from Anglo-Norman French enditement, from enditer (see indict)

definitions: a formal charge or accusation of a serious crime
shortDefinitions: formal charge or accusation of serious crime

definitions: the action of indicting or being indicted

examples.text: the indictment of twelve people who had imported cocaine

shortDefinitions: action of indicting or being indicted

definitions: a thing that serves to illustrate that a system or situation is bad and deserves to be condemned

examples.text: these rapidly escalating crime figures are an indictment of our society

shortDefinitions: thing that serves to illustrate that system or situation is bad and deserves to be condemned
